page.title: 02INDUSTRY
page.content: There are 3 major{engineering}firms in the district. The largest one is Renolds which employs a total of 630. They make gear reducing units, machine tools and rotors. They have 400 agencies in 100 countries around the world. The second largest firm, Manesty, employing 158 people, makes tablet and coating machines. The third firm is Tomlinsons who employ 90 and use sheet metal to make drying and raising machinery, much of which is exported worldwide. They also make machines for making paper pulp into food packaging. There are 2 smaller engineering firms, K and C Engineering and C Norris who make central heating radiators and springs respectively. Several firms occupy mills formerly used by the textile industry. One such firm is T.P.T. which stands for Total Packaging Technology. The firm employs
